title: Apple event seen largely 'as expected' by Wall Street (AAPL) - Seeking Alpha
description: Apple event seen largely 'as expected' by Wall Street (AAPL)  Seeking Alpha
page_title: Apple event seen largely 'as expected' by Wall Street (AAPL) | Seeking Alpha
summary: The responses from Wall Street to the recent announcements from Apple's annual fall product event were largely "as expected." The new hardware product releases were seen as evolutionary rather than revolutionary, with the features being generally in line with forecasted predictions. Notable surprises included the inclusion of sleep apnea detection for the Apple Watch and hearing aid functionality for AirPod Pros. However, the rollout of AI was considered slow and underwhelming. Analysts expect aggressive marketing of AI functionality, but predict that consumer upgrades could be delayed until later this year or iPhone 17. A cautious rollout of AI is seen to be beneficial for Apple in the long run and it's expected to drive a "renaissance of iPhone growth." Consequently, Apple shares fell by 1% in pre-market trading on Tuesday.

title: What the Options Market Tells Us About Apple - Benzinga
description: What the Options Market Tells Us About Apple  Benzinga
page_title: What the Options Market Tells Us About Apple - Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) - Benzinga
summary: Analysis of options history for Apple Inc. has revealed a conspicuous bearish move by financial giants, with only 36% of traders showing a bullish stance while 41% demonstrated bearish tendencies. The analysis identified 68 unusual trades, of which 13 were puts valued at $1,230,050 and 55 were calls worth $3,957,417. Market movers are reportedly focusing on a price band between $165 and $240 for Apple over a three-month period. Insights from volume and open interest suggest that stock liquidity and interest in Apple's options at certain strike prices are key to market dynamics. The current position of Apple shows a slight decrease of -0.16% at $222.41, with the underlying stock considered neutral between being overbought and oversold. Several professional analysts have voiced their views on Apple's stock, indicating an average price target of $274.4
